Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: We need to convert raw system log into a process mining event log, with at least Case ID, Activity Name, Timestamp. Possibly other attributes like App, Window, etc. We must identify cases: grouping events into coherent process instances. We need to think about what constitutes a case: logical unit of user work such as editing a specific document, handling a particular email, or reviewing a certain PDF. The raw log includes multiple apps: Microsoft Word (two documents: Quarterly_Report.docx and Document1.docx), Google Chrome (email), Adobe Acrobat (PDF), Microsoft Excel (Budget).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: One approach: Each document (or each work object) is a case. So each distinct window (document) could be a separate case. Thus we can define case IDs based on each unique window (document). This yields 5 cases: Document1, Quarterly_Report, Email - Inbox (or Annual Meeting email), Report_Draft, Budget_2024.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Alternatively, we could treat each activity thread as a case: for each project maybe combine related work. For instance, the user might be preparing a quarterly report that involves editing a Word doc, referencing a PDF, using budget Excel data, and sending email. Could treat as one case (the quarterly report). But then the email is separate perhaps.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The instruction: If multiple plausible interpretations of the cases exist, choose the one that leads to a coherent, analyst-friendly event log. Thus we will assign case IDs for each unique window title (document).

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: List events with mapping: 1. FOCUS (Word, Quarterly_Report.docx) -> Open Document (Quarterly_Report) ... FOCUS on a document => Open Document, TYPING => Edit Document, SAVE => Save Document, CLOSE => Close Document, SWITCH => Switch Application, CLICK open email => Open Email, SCROLL => Read Email, CLICK reply => Reply to Email, TYPING in email => Compose Email, CLICK send => Send Email, SWITCH to PDF => Open PDF, SCROLL PDF => Scroll PDF, HIGHLIGHT => Highlight Text, FOCUS Excel => Open Spreadsheet, TYPING Excel => Edit Spreadsheet, SAVE Excel => Save Spreadsheet.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Translate raw low-level actions into higher-level process steps or standardized activity names. Choose meaningful, consistent activity names that will make sense for process analysis. Well adopt these standard activity names: Open Document (for FOCUS on a document), Edit Document (for TYPING), Save Document (for SAVE), Close Document (for CLOSE), Switch Application (for SWITCH), Open Email (for CLICK open email), Read Email (for SCROLL), Reply to Email (for CLICK reply), Compose Email (for TYPING), Send Email (for CLICK send), Open PDF (for SWITCH to PDF), Scroll PDF (for SCROLL), Highlight Text (for HIGHLIGHT), Open Spreadsheet (for FOCUS Excel), Edit Spreadsheet (for TYPING), Save Spreadsheet (for SAVE).

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Assign case IDs: Case Document1 includes events: 09:00:00 FOCUS (Open Document), 09:00:30 TYPING (Edit), 09:01:00 TYPING (Edit), 09:01:15 SAVE (Save), 09:01:45 SWITCH (Switch Away), 09:06:00 SWITCH (Switch to Document1), 09:06:15 TYPING (Edit), 09:06:30 SAVE (Save), 09:07:00 CLOSE (Close). Similar for Quarterly_Report, Email, PDF, Excel.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Now verify that we have correct mapping for each row, and ensure case IDs match. Produce table sorted by timestamp globally, with columns Case ID, Activity, Timestamp, Application, Window Title.
